name: ConnectEvent
documentation:
A runtime-generated event that indicates a client has successfully connected to the Fluxzero Runtime.

This event includes metadata such as the client's name, instance ID, session ID, and the service endpoint it connected to.

Use Cases

  • Track client connection activity for monitoring or alerting
  • Audit log of system uptime or usage
@see DisconnectEvent

fields.name: client
fields.documentation: Logical client name, typically set via {@code ClientConfiguration#getClientName()}.

fields.name: clientId
fields.documentation: Unique client instance ID (e.g., including machine identifier).

fields.name: service
fields.documentation: Name of the service the client connected to (e.g., {@code event-sourcing-endpoint}).

fields.name: sessionId
fields.documentation: Internal (websocket) session ID used by the Fluxzero Runtime to track this connection.
